caption: THE BEST! Love this place, the cocktails, the food, the ownership, the vibe. Not nearly enough unique, deserving businesses like this in our corner of the UWS. Thoughtful menu that is well executed. You can’t go wrong with anything you order, really. Love the burger and all the apps! So glad to see them reopen with the warmer weather — we plan to be regulars with our newborn in his stroller. Support this place, people!

We came here on a Saturday evening for one cocktail before dinner. We were told everyone in the party who was drinking had to order a separate dish. This differed from our experience with other bars so we asked for clarification and were told it was a new regulation from Governor Cuomo just that day. Couldn't find it posted anywhere and seemed unlikely since regulations have been loosened recently, not tightened. Food, which was delicious, came, was eaten, still no cocktails, the purpose of our visit there. When we inquired, the bartender hadn't even stared making them yet. We should have cancelled the drinks order at that point but instead ended up slamming then back quickly so we could make our reservations. Not at all the experience we were hoping for. Staff was very good about masks and sanitizing tables.
Chicken sandwich and jerk chicken are my go-to's
Delicious spicy margarita! Ordered two!
Very well executed food. Beautiful interior for when Rona dies down
The lemon brioche french toast is fantastic if you're looking for something sweet and light. They make an excellent piña colada. Friendly staff, and as others have mentioned, an eclectic menu.
(Translated by Google) All right  (Original) Bien
Poor service.
Stopped by for brunch. Super chill spot. We ordered the burger and chicken sandwich. Both were excellent!
Great bartenders with a huge amount of knowledge. It's hard to find a drink they can't make, even if it's not on the menu.

If I could, I’d give a ZERO STARS to this place!! First, I almost swallowed a rubber band that was into my salad! We said that to out server/bartender, who just simply took away the plate (of course I didn’t want eat anything else in this place). Then, when check arrived, we were charged for that salad!! We were so shocked, we didn’t see berry down that salad was kind of canceled. We called the waiter to ask about that! He was extra rude, disrespectful and said never to come back!!!! Just because we asked the question about the bill!! TERRIBLE COSTUMER SERVICE!!! NEVER COME BACK TO THAT PLACE!!!

Although I was sitting outside,  the drinks were delicious and so was my appetizer. The service was very good and the staff followed social distancing considering the amount of people at the time.  I'd gladly go back
So good. The menu description doesn’t do the food justice!!!! The food is absolutely delicious!
My fav spot in the neighborhood. Great drinks, great food, great service
Cool spot.  Good food and good music...might attract a little more of the younger Columbia crowd if that's your thing.
One of our many neighborhood bars in MV!
Great drinks. Cozy and casual atmosphere.
Delicious food; excellent, inventive cocktails; and a super friendly staff... What's not to love?
It was a cute little place with great drinks with friendly and creative staff, I'm just sorry I didn't have the time to dine. I will return for a meal next time.
Really cool bar with great cocktails and good food
Three words: Get. The. Burger.

Atmosphere/layout: cocktail bar; dimly lit/mood lighting; food menu with a dozen or so cocktail choices; 10-seat bar, a couple of high tables, three booths and a counter space in the back for more seating; no TVs  Service: Solid bartender  Food/drink: Ordered the Nobody's Burger (came with fries) and shared the BBQ Jerk Wings - OK; El Peligro (their take on El Peligroso cocktail) - good
really nice mixed drinks.
Best lunch break in town!

I've been here 3 times and was extremely impressed the first time. Louis was the bartender and he made me the most perfect penicillin cocktail I have ever had. My second visit was considerably less auspicious. My drinks were weak and cloyingly sweet. My third visit Louis was my bartender again so I was hoping for a repeat of my initial visit. I was sorely disappointed. He too made my drink weak and sweet. The food was surprisingly good so I may return for victuals and vino at some point, but will avoid cocktails. Twice bitten, forever shy.

Intimate eatery with an eclectic menu. It was a new find and a wonderful place to share cheer and merriment with good friends. Although service was handled entirely through the bar, the service was great and attentive (minus the mix-up on getting tea in a timely fashion). I would visit this place many times over. I hear they're great for brunch! That will be my next try of this place.
Wonderful drinks, charming service, just lovely. Ross is a delight!!!
Popeye's who??? Hands down an outstanding chicken sandwich. Good portions and very welcoming staff. It was like visiting with friends. Great experience.
Good cocktails, nice bite, good crowd
Absolutely fantastic place. Love the design,  the lighting, the set up,  everything.  My new favorite neighbor hangout
Delicious food and great drinks. Unassuming little neighborhood gem with a trendy atmosphere
Lovely and nice to hangout with friends

The first time I came to Nobody Told me, I had low expectations. We’ve all seen bars in this location come and go.  However, I heard that a veteran chef of Dovetail was at the helm.  This is now my favorite bar. There are industry professionals at every level.  Do yourself a favor, and order the chicken sandwich. Bring a friend, because the serving is huge.  Want a burger? Same thing.  The UWS has needed a bar like this, and this is the team to do it.  Ross, in particular, gave me excellent service.  Go downtown If you want to eat subpar food and wait in line.  See you there 👌
amazing cocktails and food 😋

Inventive and tasty cocktails, and unexpectedly delicious food. As in, we'd come here to eat even if they didn't have jazzy drinks. Add that to the warm and laid back vibe, and all's right with the world.

Awesome neighborhood spot with great drinks and food. It's a great late night hangout with chill bartenders and good late night snacks. I usually go with a few friends and get a negroni, maybe a Tecate, and some chips and truffle queso.

Really cute spot with good vibe and interesting menu (bites and drinks). Bar seating and a handful of pub height tables. Not too noisy or too quiet- perfect for a date. Down side was the service, unfortunately. We weren’t approached after 10 minutes of waiting, so we left our stools to order at the bar. When our drinks were ready the waiter rudely called us over (by shouting the name of the drink) instead of walking the two feet to serve them. Really a shame considering it wasn’t that busy.

Nobody Told Me that my birthday celebration with friends would turn sour upon going here as Part 2 to yesterday's fantastic birthday brunch. My review prior to this shows how appreciative we are of the basic little things and that most if not all of my reviews are always about commending places and the good stuff.  Anyway.. Days prior, I was planning my birthday brunch with friends and since I really wanted to check out this place given all the 'good' reviews, the general plan was to stay Uptown then. That's fine because most of us live in UWS anyway and one lives in UES. We walked 11 blocks from W. 97th and arrived here at 4PMish. We were coming in next to a small group of older customers and since the place wasn't even 20% occupied, we were given the choice to which table to take. We took the one behind/beside the bar since we were 5 and could fit in, also following through our little private space from our brunch earlier. Pretty nice, despite the fact that the place was really hot. Overall, we liked the vibe of the place and the music. We were at least greeted hello by the guy in white shirt. I knew that you order by the bar so some of us ordered ahead then my husband and I followed and did too. The Asian bartender took our orders in a nonchalant way, turned his back from us, and I had to ask and offer my card, to which he says, "we already have a card from your table. You can ask us how to split it later." Again, unfriendly tone. Like why? Did you woke up on the wrong side of the bed and you hate the world? Anyway, we're all professionals and always believe in taking the high road, so we let it slide since we're there to celebrate. We could already feel something wasn't right though.  Drinks were finally made for our group of 5. The Asian guy puts it by the side for us to get, no issues really. And then we started to observe how different we were treated from the other tables. First off: they actually 'interacted' nicely with them. Second: they actually brought the drinks to their tables. Third: the rest of the tables were given a bottle of water and glasses. Now this was the little test that we wanted to see if there was some discrimination happening. I asked nicely, could we please have some water? The asian guy says, you can get it yourself and pointed a corner where the pitcher of water is made available. My friend stood up and got it for me and then we noticed another table who was served water again. Well, wow. That was the turning point. We were there to check out and support a new business which describes themselves as a 'friendly neighborhood bar'. I'm a regular at The Penrose in UES and Salon de Ning at the Península and they are not stuck up people. I also enjoy Danny Meyer's restaurants esp. Manhatta and Don Angie and their restaurant group and they are fantastic, expensive, yet so worth it, because of their friendliness and quality of food and drinks. We were prepared to stay for hours and try everything but I guess they're not into 'diversity'. We still left them a good tip because that's the right thing to do but even as we walked out the door, considering they weren't even 50% full, there was no thank you or anything.  There were 2 restrooms btw (that's pretty good, rare even), however one didn't have running water and the one didn't have any bathroom tissue.  Nobody told us that our experience would be subpar so we got out of there as soon as we finished one round and checked out Dive106 which was across the street. Turns out, their 5 star reviews are pretty legit. We ended up staying for the next 4 hours. A place we would happily come back and tell people about. :)  Moral of the story: You don't judge a bar by its cover.

(Translated by Google) A long wait for a "cosmopolitan" really low-end ... Disappointing experience.  (Original) Une longue attente pour un “cosmopolitan” vraiment bas de gamme... Expérience décevante.
If you live on the UWS get excited. Chill environment and lovely people. Only 1 problem... ... I can't tell what's better. The Drinks or the Food!!!🤣 5 stars!
Old burger buns and soda with no fizz; otherwise, the meat was good.

This place is fantastic. I saw it on a best of NYC burger list so I had to go. You sit down and have to order food/drinks from the bar (and space your food, we got all of our food at once and it was too much). Each thing was absolutely delicious. Great burger, amaaaazing truffle queso. We also got the dates which were excellent. Drinks were good also and the bartender was one of the best I have seen in NYC, super quick and friendly. It is so reasonably priced compared to the insane 25 dollar burgers and 20 dollar apps. I live 100 blocks away from this, but would gladly take the subway ride up. Easily 5 stars!
Wow. What A great place. The music is super vibey, the drinks are super legit. Well made. Happy hour specials were nice. And the spicy chicken sandwich was to die for.  Very reasonably priced too!
Really love the inventive drinks with helpful and friendly bar staff. I look forward to coming back.
Fantastic cocktail bar with great staff, Instagrammable ambiance and awesome drinks.
Cocktails are pretty good. If you don't like loud restaurants and bars, I would avoid this place. It was very loud when we were there, that was my biggest complaint.
Great cocktails and a hell of a burger.
The interior just looks like a copy of a copy of a copy of some sort of trendy bar, and the service sucks.
Great ambiance and aesthetic, great service across the board, and an unbelievable chicken sandwich!
Incredible bar. The cocktails are ridiculous. Haven't had the food yet but the drinks are fantastic
Wonderful casual atmosphere.  Enjoyed the cocktails and  great light dinner.  Their burger is delicious!  Great spot on upper west side.  Highly recommend!
Great cocktails and spirits.
Awesome food and ambiance! The Bacon Wrapped Dates are to die for! Great bar! Fantastic music! Chef Nick, Alberto, Ross and Tom are incredibly passionate about the restaurant and it's contagious!

Excellent food and cocktails in a really nice, well decorated, ice cold (great for the summer) cocktail bar in the UWS. Friendly service and a southern-ish American food selection. Cocktails are fun and tasty, menu playfully organized by classics and not classics.
Great friendly vibe, good fries and shishito peppers. Definitely recommend!
Amazing ambiance, soundtrack and cocktails.
Great food. Great cocktails. Cool environment. Great decor. Super chill.
Great cocktails. Cool staff. Much needed addition to the neighborhood.
Loved it. Great ambiance and cocktail. And on top of that the food is next level. So glad to have the new bar in my neiberhood.
Good vibe, good cocktails
Amazing music selection! Interpol, TV on the Radio, Vampire Weekend...
Amazing bar, vibes, food. Gem on the UWS

Great food, great drinks, great music in a cool little spot on the UWS.  Dia de los zombies was strong but refreshing in a prayer candle glass.  The menu was an inspired take on traditional bar food.  We’ll be back.

Liked this place from the moment I stumbled in!  Stunning aesthetic interior with an eclectic, upbeat vibe. Upon much contemplation, I finally decided on a deliciously inventive mezcal cocktail that satisfied cravings I didn’t know I had. Feasted on some wonderfully crunchy and salty shishito peppers. Bartender was outgoing and reminded me to sprinkle the lime on top! The perfect touch!! 😅😛  Random: but there is a shelf in the bathroom which for a woman is amazing! There’s never somewhere to leave my purse or phone 😁🤗  Highly recommend for a fun date night or hangs with friends in UWS 🍹🥃🍸🥂

You know the secret will get out with a bar called Nobody Told Me! But really, nobody told me the food and drinks here would be so creative and brilliant. You can certainly go here for cocktails alone and not be disappointed. The carbonated cosmo on tap is one of my favorites (Where else in the city can you find that?) as well as the The Guilty of Everything cocktail, which will stand up in any court. This place will become known as a snacker’s paradise because of dishes like the blistered shishito peppers and the chèvre arancini. But don’t feel shy about sitting here for dinner as well. The fried chicken sandwich is one of the best in the city. Lastly, make sure you sample their intriguing take on milk and cookies for dessert. You’ll just have to find out for yourself.
Pricey, but well-made and innovative cocktails (though some you're paying for ice more than the alcohol /a flavor). Bartenders were entertaining and delivered accurate orders.
Incredible cocktails in a trendy, high-energy environment.  Great service and awesome bartenders.

Really good bar food (best burger in the area), knowledgeable mixologists, great selection of spirits, and a bright airy ambiance. Good prices as well! If you've ever been to Penrose in the Upper East Side, you will find the Nobody Told Me food and drink experience quite similar. High recommend!!
Great new cocktail bar in the neighborhood. Looking forward to coming back for more beverages and bites

If you're looking for craft cocktails and small plates on the upper UWS, this is one of the few available with great cocktails and food. The food was surprisingly delicious.  Lounge seating at the front has big windows that open which is a bonus.  One note - No table service...must order at the bar and bring to your table.  Only downside is the incredibly bright neon sign inside on the wall (not a place you want to go on a first date - lol) and the decor is rather vanilla.  Staff was nice, but could perhaps be a bit more outgoing and friendly.  Overall, would go back for the food and drinks.
Great cocktails and amazing food. Highly recommended! Everything on the menu is delicious, and the fried chicken sandwich is 💣!
Such delicious bar food! Love the ambiance and friendly staff.
Delicious cocktails and food! Nice atmosphere
Great food, inventive cocktails, awesome atmosphere. Total Upper West Side gem.
Fantastic!
